rootCause: Compromise of the software build and code-signing infrastructure of SolarWinds' Orion Platform.
impact: Infected systems of up to 18,000 SolarWinds customers, including multiple U.S. federal agencies like the Treasury and Commerce Departments. Enabled extensive espionage and data exfiltration.
description: Russian state-sponsored actors (APT29/Cozy Bear) executed a highly sophisticated supply chain attack by injecting malicious code into updates for the SolarWinds Orion software. This allowed them to gain long-term access to the networks of thousands of high-value government and private sector targets globally.

sources.title: CISA Alert (AA20-352A): Advanced Persistent Threat Compromise of Government Agencies, Critical Infrastructure, and Private Sector Organizations

rootCause: Data breach in the company's server network.
impact: Forced a temporary shutdown of production plants and data centers in India, the US, UK, Brazil, and Russia to contain the incident.
description: Indian multinational pharmaceutical company Dr. Reddy's was hit by a cyberattack that disrupted its global operations. The incident occurred shortly after the company received approval to conduct clinical trials for a COVID-19 vaccine in India, highlighting the targeting of the pharma sector during the pandemic.

sources.title: Dr Reddy's shuts key plants after cyber attack

rootCause: Attackers used phone spear-phishing (vishing) to trick several Twitter employees into providing credentials for internal administrative tools.
impact: Hijacked 130 high-profile accounts, including those of Barack Obama, Joe Biden, and Elon Musk, to promote a cryptocurrency scam, defrauding users of over $100,000.
description: A group of young hackers gained access to Twitter's internal tools by manipulating employees. They used this access to take over celebrity and corporate accounts, broadcasting a bitcoin scam that raised serious questions about the platform's security and the risks of insider threats.

sources.title: An Update on Our Security Incident

rootCause: A ransomware attack on the company's self-hosted environment.
impact: Data was exfiltrated from the networks of thousands of non-profit, educational, and healthcare organizations that use Blackbaud's services. Blackbaud paid the ransom.
description: Cloud software provider Blackbaud was hit by a ransomware attack where the threat actor both encrypted systems and exfiltrated a subset of data. The incident was a supply chain attack affecting a vast number of client organizations globally, who then had to notify their own donors and customers.

rootCause: Likely initiated through a phishing email, allowing the Ryuk ransomware to propagate across the network.
impact: Disabled IT systems at approximately 250 U.S. hospitals and facilities, forcing staff to use pen and paper and divert ambulances. The attack cost the company an estimated $67 million.
description: UHS, a Fortune 500 hospital and healthcare provider, was hit by one of the largest medical-related cyberattacks in U.S. history. The Ryuk ransomware attack severely disrupted patient care across its national network of hospitals, showcasing the life-threatening potential of cyberattacks on healthcare.

sources.title: Universal Health Services says Ryuk ransomware attack cost it $67 million in 2020
